Job Posting:165868 - Position: S25 Front End Developer (Intern) 165868B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 01/29/2025 09:00 AM Through UBC Science Co-op 01/20/2025 02:42 PM Expired ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Province / State Country AlgaeCal #118 - 1231 Pacific Blvd Vancouver BC Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2025 - Summer S25 Front End Developer (Intern) 165868B Co-op Position Vancouver, BC Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD 3500.0 per month for 40 Major List Would you like to intern with one of the brightest Dev teams in North America? A tight-knit group of some of the best developers, problem-solvers, and software engineers around. They're scary-smart. They love what they do. And they're using their coding genius to make the world a better place. This isn't just an internship - if you've got the chops, it's a launchpad for a lifetime of success. About Us At AlgaeCal, we're driven by a single idea. To end the fear of bone loss. It's a big mission. In the United States, an estimated 54 million people have fragile bones. And they're scared. Scared of snapping a bone. Scared of being forced to quit their favorite hobbies. And worst of all, they are scared of losing their independence. The good news? AlgaeCal is the world's only clinically backed natural solution to this problem. We help thousands of people say goodbye to fear, fracture, and frailty. If that excites you, you'll find no better place to continue your career than at AlgaeCal. About You You have a solid grasp of front-end development fundamentals and can skillfully transform theoretical concepts into functional, user-friendly interfaces. About Your Opportunity Here are a few things you can expect to be involved in while at AlgaeCal. Get Great at Dev: You'll gain hands-on experience creating seamless, user-friendly web experiences. You'll work on projects ranging from responsive WordPress blog features to custom website templates. With guidance from our seasoned dev team, you'll master the art of balancing clean code with outstanding design. Bring Designs to Life: You'll collaborate closely with designers and content creators to transform creative visions into functional, dynamic web elements. From pixel-perfect layouts to interactive features, you'll bridge the gap between ideas and execution. Bug Whispering: You'll learn valuable debugging skills by tackling real-world challenges. Whether it's fixing quirky CSS issues or solving JavaScript puzzles, you'll learn how to become the go-to problem solver on the team. In fact, you'll get so good at squishing bugs we might even send you to Klendathu. Master the Dev Arsenal: Sharpen your skills with the latest tools and frameworks. From Semantic HTML and Sass to React and Node.js, you'll expand your knowledge base and grow your expertise in the tech stack we use every day. Flex Your Feature-Building Muscle: You'll learn how to develop and deploy features for our WordPress blog and website templates. This is your chance to own projects and showcase your ability to deliver impactful solutions that look great and work even better. Collaboration & Communication: Be part of a tight-knit team where your ideas matter. You'll participate in brainstorming sessions, sprint planning, and code reviews, growing both your technical and collaborative skills in a supportive environment. Stay Ahead of the Curve: Get hands-on experience working with cutting-edge technologies and platforms, like AWS and Bitbucket. You'll learn to navigate these tools like a pro while staying in sync with the latest industry trends. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through UBC Science Co-op Cover Letter Required? Yes Address Cover Letter to Hiring Team Special Application Instructions How To Apply Opportunities like this don't come along often, and we have much to offer our successful applicants. So, to make sure our future Front End Developer Intern is the real deal, will be a great fit, and will thrive at AlgaeCal, we ask a little more than your run-of- the-mill job application: If this position is for you, please respond to this advertisement with your resume and cover letter. Please, read carefully: 1. Write a cover letter addressing: • Why you're the best Front End Developer Intern for this role. Give quantifiable examples of related achievements. • Describe why you fit perfectly with our values. Read them here: http://shorturl.at/lptFT • What's the toughest challenge you've ever overcome in your life? How did you overcome it? • What are the last three books you've read? What do you do for fun? • 2. Submit your cover letter and resume That's it! We know our hiring process is challenging, but it's our way of selecting the best -and your way of ensuring your AlgaeCal teammates are top-notch. Click the "Apply" button on this page and upload your cover letter and resume. ***Note: Applications without a cover letter will not be read! We're expecting a LOT of interest in this position, so act quickly and you can also expect a prompt response.
